summary: Over 9 million low-income children who don’t qualify for Medicaid use CHIP—the Children’s Health Insurance Program. Forty-two states with certain types of CHIP programs must take steps to minimize or prevent “crowd-out”—when families substitute CHIP for private health insurance. We found that there isn’t much information on how often substitution occurs. All 42 states have at least 1 procedure to prevent substitution, such as searching...
title: Children's Health Insurance Program: Efforts to Measure and Address Potential Substitution for Private Health Insurance
